org.raistlic.common.taskqueue

Interface TaskQueue.Controller

  • Enclosing interface:
    TaskQueue

    public static interface TaskQueue.Controller
    The controller that holds the instance of the task queue, and controls its life cycle.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TaskQueue get()
      The method returns the task queue that the handler is handling.
      boolean start()
      Starts the task queue, if it is not already running; otherwise the method simply does nothing and returns false.
      void stop(boolean interruptCurrentTask)
      The method signals the task queue to stop at an appropriate time.
      boolean stop(long timeout, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      Shuts down the task queue(if the queue is running), and the current (calling) thread waits for the queue to shutdown, for timeout milliseconds.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        TaskQueue get()
        The method returns the task queue that the handler is handling.
        Returns:
        the task queue that the handler is handling.

      • start

        boolean start()
        Starts the task queue, if it is not already running; otherwise the method simply does nothing and returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the task queue's running state is successfully changed as a result of the call.

      • stop

        boolean stop(long timeout,
             java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
      throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
             java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        Shuts down the task queue(if the queue is running), and the current (calling) thread waits for the queue to shutdown, for timeout milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum number of milli-seconds to wait for the queue shutdown.
        timeUnit - the unit of the timeout .
        Returns:
        true if the queue's running state is changed as a result of the call.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the current (calling) thread is interrupted while waiting for the queue to shutdown.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if waiting time out, in which case the signal to shut down the queue is already sent, and that the queue may very well shut down at any time later after the exception is thrown.

      • stop

        void stop(boolean interruptCurrentTask)
        The method signals the task queue to stop at an appropriate time.
        Parameters:
        interruptCurrentTask - true if the currently executed task should be interrupted.
